title: sewing / stitching font
content:
I'm looking for a font that resembles stitches or sewing, not in a crude way like stitches on a wound but more elegant and flowing. I would be very happy to hear your suggestion. Thank you.  
Petter
author: P_P

comments.content: There's a lot around: Umbrella's [Brea](http://web.archive.org/web/20120414231318/http:/http/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000002), Fountain's [Gretel](http://web.archive.org/web/20120414231318/http:/www.fountaintype.com/typefaces/gretel), [FF Nelio](http://web.archive.org/web/20120414231318/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_nelio/) or [flat-it's Flat10 Holy](http://web.archive.org/web/20120414231318/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/flat10-holy/), and I'm sure there are others.

Thank you sapitau for all your sugggestions. The image I have in my head though is less embroider and more sewing if that makes sense. I want the outline to be made up by the stitches, not embroider "crosses", hard to explain..
[Topstitch](http://web.archive.org/web/20120414231318/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/topstitch/4) is the closest i've come so far but its a bit to "dottie"

Oh, I'm sorry looks like I'm more of an embroiderer myself. Stitched font is much harder to find I reckon (especially the elegant ones). Do you mean something like [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20120414231318/http:/embird.com/sw/embird/letter.htm)?? (or do it yourself if you have any Illustrator-skills)
I think your right, I'll have to enter illustrator mode. Thank you again for taking an interest.

The pointilles version of Ecolier might work. [http://www.dafont.com/ecolier.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20120414231318/http:/www.dafont.com/ecolier.font "http://www.dafont.com/ecolier.font")

Sharon
Does cross stitch count? [Lars Törnqvist Typografi](http://web.archive.org/web/20120414231318/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/lars+t%C3%B6rnqvist/fonts/) has a few.
